Console output might get interspersed with multi-threaded tests, but=C2=A0i=
f you create XML=C2=A0testresults with the JUNITREPORT task,=C2=A0it isn't.=

=C2=A0Regards, Jan

david@...>

Subject: Re: [junit] getting specific information on where a test f=
ailed.


Brendan,

Test failure information should be reported through the =
ant task,
regardless of whether it is multi-threaded. Are you saying that t=
he
output from your program is interspersed with the output from ant? Is
it=
 possible to redirect the output from your program?

David

On Wed, Oct 29,=
 2008 at 6:20 PM, Brendan Miller <catphive@catphive. net> wrote:
> I'm usin=
g junit3.8.1 and running my tests through the junit ant task.
>
> I have a =
problem where an exception is getting thrown in a worker
> thread, and I'm =
not able to get specific information about which test
> it failed on from j=
unit. If I just print the information to standard
> out it gets pushed toge=
ther with all the other stdout information and
> doesn't tell me what test =
was running when it was printed. If I call
> System.exit( 1), then I get a =
BUILDFAILED message that tells me what
> *class* containing the tests faile=
d, but it doesn't tell me the exact
> method of the test.
>
> How can I for=
ce more specific output? Should I be using a different
> test runner? I nee=
d one that will work with junit 3.8.1.
>
> Thanks,
> Brendan
>
>
